Sorry, I did not see any notification from bitbucket so I missed these messages. Indeed the easiest way is to use yaourt (or any AUR helper). Then you can also jump to the temporary directory created (probably /tmp/yaourt-tmp-$USER/aur-gazebo), and check the logs of the build process, or re-run make (the build directory for CMake is /tmp/yaourt-tmp-$USER/aur-gazebo/src/gazebo-xxx/build where xxx is the current version number). The PKGBUILD itself is quite clear, you just need to know that makepkg splits packaging data in a src directory where you can find your source and build files, and a pkg directory where "installed" files are put before generating the actual package tarball.

Note than you can also download the PKGBUILD (and associated files) with yaourt -G gazebo, go to the newly created directory (gazebo in your current directory), and run makepkg from there. It's really that simple with Arch :o)

@v01d if you confirm that it was indeed just that and that things work as intended, could you send me the patch (or make a PR on GitHub) so that I can patch the build until this is officially released?
